_header: A poor widow somedeal stoop in age
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Nun’s Priest’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 626 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
A poure widowe somdel stopen in agewas whilom dwellynge in a narowe
                    cotage…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…as seith oure lorde so make vs alle good menand bringe vs to
                    his highe blis Amen
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…and next folwyng bigynneth his tale (f. 206); The nonnys preste
                    (rubric, RT); Here endith the nonnes prest his tale… (f. 215)

BodBar20.First Lines:
A pore widow somdel stope in ageWas whilom dwellyng in a narow
                    cotage…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…As seit my lord so make vs alle gode menAnd bryng vs alle to
                    his highe blysse amen
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…& here bygynnyth þe tale (f. 246); Here endith þe
                    Nonne preostes tale… (f. 255)

Bod414.First Lines:
[A] Pore widow sumdele stept in AgeWas whilom duelling in a narow
                    cotage…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…As saith my lord god make us al good menAnd bring us alle to
                    his high blisse Amen
Bod414.Attributed Title:
The Nonnes prestis tale of the cokke / and the henne Chauntclere and
                    pertlot (f. 172v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
A Poor widow som dele stape in ageAs whilom dwelling in a narow
                    cage…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…As seith my lorde so make vs al gode menAnd bring vs all to
                    his high blisse amen
BodHatDon1.Note:
VII.2902, 2922 omitted; 3831-2, 2965-6, 3391-2 reversed; 2822, 3135
                    inserted in margin.
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next beginneth the Nonnes Prest tale of the Cok and of þe
                    Foxe (rubric, f. 217); The Nonne Prest (rubric, RT); Here endeth the Nonnes
                    Prest tale… (rubric, f. 224)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
A pore widow somdel stope in ageWas whilom duelling in a pore
                    cotage…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…And to him rennen his wifes alleÞus real as a Prince in
                    his halle…
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
HEre begynneþ þe nonne prestis tale (f. 259); Þe nonne prest
                    (rubric, RT)

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
…And casten hem ful erly for to seyleBut herkene how that the
                    oo man fille in a gret peryle…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…ffull is myn hert of Reuell & solasBut sodenly hym fel a
                    sorewfull cas…

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
…As for that night departe companyAnd ich of hem goth into
                    his hostelery…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…As saith my lord god make vs al good menAnd bryng vs al to
                    the hihe blis Amen
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title:
the nonne preest (rubric, RT); Here endith the non preestes tale…
                    (rubric, f. 119)

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:
A pore widewe somdel stope in agWas whilom dwelling in a narwe
                    cotage…
BodRawPoe223.Last Lines:
…As seith my lord so make us alle gode menAnd bringe us to his
                    hiȝe blisse Amen
BodRawPoe223.Attributed Title:
Here beginneth the Nonnes Prestes tale of Chauntecler & Pertelote (f.
                        194v, positioned in the middle of an otherwise blank, ruled
                    verso); Chauntecler Pertlote (RT); Here endith the Nonnes Prestes tale…
                    (rubric, f. 204)

A Pore widowe somdele stape in ageWas whilom dwellyng in a narwe a
                    cotage…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…As seith my lorde so make vs alle good menAnd brynge vs to

OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title: Here bygynnetħ the Nonnes prestes tale (rubric, f. 166)

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
A Pouere wydewe somdel stope in ageWas whilom dwellyng in a narwe
                    cotage…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…As seiþ my lord so make vs all goode menAnd bringe vs
                    all to his heihe blisse amen
OxfCCC198.Attributed Title:

OxfNew314.First Lines:
A pore widow som deel stept in ageWas sumtyme dwellyng in a
                    cotage…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:
…As seith my lorde so make vs alle gode menAnd brynge vs to
                    his hiȝ blisse Amen
OxfNew314.Attributed Title:
…And here begynnyth his tale (rubric, f. 249)v); Nonnys
                    Prest (rubric, RT)

OxfTri49.First Lines:
A pore wonman somdell stope in agethat whelom dwellid in an narowe
                    cotage…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…as seith my lorde god make vs al gode menand bringe vs al
                    vnto his hie blisse amen
OxfTri49.Attributed Title:
ffabula presbeteri de Chauntecler / And Pertelt (rubric, f. 231);
                    Chauntecler (rubric, RT)

CULDd424.First Lines:
…What eyleth yow to grone in this manereȜe ben a verrey
                    slepere fy for shame…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…As seith my lord so make vs alle goode menAn brynge vs to his
                    blisse Amen
CULDd424.Note:
Followed by sixteen-line ‘Nun’s Priest’s
                    Epilogue’ (4870). VII.2821-2889 lost; 3163-6
                    omitted.
CULDd424.Attributed Title: Heere endeth the Tale of the Nonnes Preest (f. 195v)
CULDd424.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Cambridge MS. Dd.4.24 of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales,
                Completed by the Egerton MS. 2726 (The Haistwell MS).
The Chaucer Society
         1st Series, no. 95 (Part 1, issue for 1901) and 96 (Part 2, issue for
            1902).

CULGg427.First Lines:
…His color was reddere than the fyne coralAnd batayled as it
                    were a castel wal…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…The dokis cryedyn as men wolde hem quelleAnd that the
                    Romaynys haddyn brente Cartage…
CULGg427.Note:
VII.2821-58, 3391-446 lost; 2958, 3365 inserted at foot; 3365 follows
                    3390 as final surviving lines.
CULGg427.Facsimiles:
Parkes,  Malcolm B.,  and  Richard Beadle.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Poetical Works. Geoffrey Chaucer. A Facsimile of Cambridge University
                Library MS Gg.4.27. 3 vols Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1979 (vol. 1); 1980 (vols. 2-3).
CULGg427.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             The Cambridge MS (University Library, Gg.4.27) of Chaucer’s
                Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 4, 10, 17, 28, 33, 40, 52, 66. London: Trübner,
            1868-79.

CULIi326.First Lines:
A pore wedowe somdele stepe in ageWas some tyme dwellyng in a
                    narowe cotage…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…As saithe my lorde so make vs all good menAnd brynge vs to
                    the highe blisse Amen
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
Here endeth the prologe of the nonnes preest / And here begynneth his tale
                    (f. 211v); Nonnes preste (rubric, RT); Here Endeth the nonnes prestes
                    tale… (f. 219)

CULMm25.First Lines:
A pore wydowe som dele stope in ageWas whilom dwellynge in an
                    narowe cotage…
CULMm25.Last Lines:
…As seith my lorde so make us all goode menAnde brynge us all
                    to þe hye blysse amen
CULMm25.Attributed Title:
…& here begynneth þe tale (f. 164v); þe
                    Nonne preste tale (RT); Here endeth þe nonne prestes tale… (f.
                        170v)

BLEge2863.First Lines:
…With stikkes & drye diche wiþ outeIn whiche sche
                    hadde acok þat highte chaunteclere…
BLEge2863.Last Lines:
…So aferd for berkynge of doggesAnd showtyng of men & of
                    women eke…

BLSl1685.First Lines:
A pore wydowe some dele stope in ageWas whilom dwellyng in a narow
                    cotage…
BLSl1685.Last Lines:
…But sir I dyd it nouȝt in no wicked ententeCometh doune
                    & I shalle telle you what I ment…
BLSl1685.Note:
VII.3424-46 lost; 2973, 3043-8 omitted; 2861-2, 3391-2 reversed.
                    Catchwords on f. 222v: ‘I shalle’. The rest of the MS
                    lost.
BLSl1685.Attributed Title:
…& begynneth þe tale (f. 214v); The Nunne Prest
                    (rubric, RT)

NLW21972D.First Lines:
[…]om dwel[…]ng[…][…]groue
                    stondyng…
[…]par[…]ee no re[…][…]n ne
                    compleyne…
[…]hall[…][…]ere in h[…]
                    pasture…
NLW21972D.Last Lines:
…His kombe was redder than the fyn coralAnd batailled as it
                    were a castel wal…
…God wot it reweth me and haue good dayAnd thus he toke his
                    leue and went his way…
…If I conseil of women w[…]de blamePas ouer for I seyde
                    it in my […]e…
NLW21972D.Note:
Three damaged leaves containing: VII.2784-2820; VII.2822-2860;
                    VII.3021-3058; VII.3060-3098; VII 3184-3222; VII.3223-3262.
NLW21972D.Attributed Title:
Here endeth the prologe / Here endeth the prologe and bygynneth the tale
                    (f. 1, foot)

                    3236, 3339 omitted.

                    Prest his tale… (f. 200)
